Description: A front mould for a standing figure of Bes, with impression. Bes is naked, with his hands on his thighs; he wears a feathered crown and stands on a low plain flat-faced plinth. The back is rounded and rough, with a deep vertical groove cut before firing. The rear mould is lost. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt, the outside fired buff in places.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Probably Ptolemaic. Comparanda. Near (figures, not moulds): Christie's 'Sale Catalogue', 13 July 1983: lot 341; de Araújo 1993: 372, no. 271, dated third to second century BC; Dunand 1990: no. 41, dated Roman period; Hodjash 2004: 101, no. 71, a flask, dated Roman period; 'LIMC' iii (2): pl. 76, Bes 19e; Weber 1914: no. 251.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3087)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
